response_parsed.title: Documenting REST APIs Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to effectively document your REST APIs using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+, enhancing the usability and maintainability of your API.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python.
It includes automatic generation of OpenAPI documentation from code.
The documentation can be accessed by appending '/docs' to the base URL of your API.
FastAPI supports multiple programming paradigms like Procedural, OOP, and ASGI.
Python 3.12+ is required for improved type hinting and performance optimizations.
version_notes: FastAPI version 0.74.0 and later support Python 3.12.
Ensure you have updated FastAPI to a compatible version before running the code examples.
caveats: While this guide covers the basics of documenting REST APIs using FastAPI, it does not cover advanced topics like security and testing.
To learn more about these areas, refer to the FastAPI documentation and other resources.
